title: Bulgur
summary: Bulgur  (from Turkish: bulgur itself from (Persian: بلغور bolġur(bolghur)/balġur(balghur)‎, lit. 'groats');[1] also riffoth from Hebrew: ריפות‎, romanized: Riffoth and burghul, from Arabic: برغل‎, romanized: burġul[2]), is a cereal food made from the cracked parboiled groats (whole grains) of several different wheat species, most often from durum wheat. It originates in West Asian cuisine.
